reviews.text: 1130 am on a Monday <br><br>Seating on the Patio. <br><br>Service was outstanding, food was delicious .<br>I had the Mac n cheese burger with Sweet Potato Fries! <br>The portion size= large <br><br>Also tried the pineapple upside down cheesecake that is NEW!  <br><br>I&#39;ll certainly be back to this particular location. <br><br>Our server (can&#39;t remember her name) but she is from SJ, California did such an outstanding job serving 3!

I&#39;m surprised to see this location of The Cheesecake Factory at only 2.5 stars. We made our first visit here recently, but have been to Cheesecake Factory locations all over the country numerous times. And, they&#39;re almost always the same. The décor is the same. The wait staff dress the same. The enormous menu is the same. Service is almost always someplace between good enough and good. Food quality is fine - not 5 star but predictable. Except for the cheesecake - the cheesecake is great. This is exactly what we experienced at the Southwest Plaza location - pleasant (and quiet) environment, good service, the food quality we expected and great cheesecake (Very Cherry Ghirardelli Chocolate Cheesecake - worth the visit all by itself). <br><br>Reading the reviews, it looks like a significant part of the problem at this location is with takeout. Can&#39;t speak to that, but we had no problems dining in. So here&#39;s my advice. Dine in. If you&#39;re an epicure, skip the meal and go straight for the cheesecake - two slices if you&#39;re really self-indulgent. Or, if your mother won&#39;t let you have dessert until you eat you meal, order a salad. It will make you feel virtuous when you order your cheesecake. I had a salad with either tuna or salmon and it was quite good. But the pièce de résistance was the Very Cherry Ghirardelli Chocolate Cheesecake - even my mother might have skipped dinner and gone straight to dessert had she known.

I&#39;ve ordered delivery many times from Cheesecake and the food is typically good except on multiple occasions they failed to include particular food items like last night.  Ordered two hamburgers with fries and received no fries!  Other instances, no cheese sauce, missing dessert and a missing side.  How does this happen?  They need to have some QA before the order is handed off.  I emailed the manager months ago and never received a response.  At least Door Dash has been exceedingly excellent about refunding for mssing items, however, it&#39;s really disappointing when you don&#39;t get what you ordered, especially at their fairly high prices.

My order was called in for pick up with 35 minutes lead time. I waited 25 minutes after the pick up time to get it. I was ignored the entire time I was there and I felt like my purchase was an inconvenience to the employees. I used their app to pay and none of the employees knew how to process my payment. It wasn&#39;t busy, my order was literally thrown together. It was $30 for two small appetizers. I&#39;m disappointed as this place used to be good.

This place has been around for a very long time, &amp; I&#39;ve eaten here on several occasions. The food is pretty good, tons of options &amp; their drinks are yummy!<br><br>I gave 4 stars because the dish I ordered which was the Spicy Cashew Chicken which I subbed for shrimp came out &amp; didn&#39;t have the slightest spiciness to it &amp; there was a heavy amount of breading that was fairly soft/soggy. Flavor was good though! <br><br>My husband ordered their Tuna Poke Bowl &amp; he liked it, but it didnt quite have enough tuna in it.<br><br>Our appetizer was so so good! We had the crab &amp; artichoke dip and would for sure get that again!! <br><br>Our drinks: pinapple mojito was very tasty a little too sweet but still yummy! My husband ordered the cucumber lemonade &amp; that was delicious! Would order that again!! <br><br>Our server Jessica was wonderful &amp; made sure to check on us frequently &amp; refil our waters! <br><br>I&#39;d definitely eat here again but I&#39;d order something different next time!

I wanted to &#34;support local businesses&#34; during the statewide lockdown due to COVID-19. So, I ordered delivery from the Cheesecake Factory through Doordash. The driver arrived at the restaraunt had waited over a half hour before my food was ready. By the time it got to me it was completely cold. I understand that these are difficult circumstances, but I can&#39;t see how the order could have been this badly screwed up, especially given the extra time the restaraunt had to prepare it. I won&#39;t be ordering from this place again.

I had a sangria at this Cheescake factory,  it was the worst sangria I have ever had....  The worst part is they charged me $12.25 for it...   The food is average at best and pretty expensive.  I think there are a lot of better places to go for money....

It was great. I ate off of the skinnylicious menu and was plenty of food. My husband love his chicken dish too. Great atmosphere as well.<br>Thanks for making our 43rd wedding anniversary a memorable one.

Great variety of foods to choose from including a skinny licious menu! A lot of alcoholic beverages as well as non alcoholic drinks. When I allow myself the cheesecake itself<br>Is absolutely wonderful!!

Decided to go to  Cheesecake Factory with my girlfriend and 2 kids instead of some other family friendly options in the area, and regretted it almost immediately. The chicken dish that my girlfriend got was terrible, and it&#39;s the dish on the menu that states &#34;their most popular dish!&#34; The chicken was undercooked and void of all flavor, potatoes with no seasoning, and veggies matched the rest. She took 2 bites and didn&#39;t want to eat anything else. I thought it couldn&#39;t really be that bad, but I was wrong. Literally no flavor in any of the items on the plate. The kids dishes were to be expected. My daughter liked her Mac and cheese and my son ate his sliders. I got the spicy cashew chicken as when I go there I normally get this dish expecting a great deal of flavor and exceptional texture and taste. What I received on the other hand.. soggy breaded chicken without the flavor I am used to having with this dish. The service was exceptional, but the food is the reason for the poor rating.. We even had to send back my girlfriends dish. She threw up when we got home as well. <br><br>I think the kitchen has given up on the cooking.

I went here after being ignored at another local restaurant. I was hangry and have never had a bad meal at TCF, so figured, what the heck. <br>I was prepared to wait, because I was in the dinner hour by the time I got there and everyone knows how Cheesecake Factories get, but I was whisked right in by the hostess. We were seated at at booth at the bar, and glad I was, because I was there to drink and eat. Probably the best dinner I had during my three days in the Littleton area! Bartender was super attentive, service was quick (even though they were packed), food was hot and awesome, as I have come to know, and the place was running like a well-oiled machine. Some local beers on-tap, and a very nice selection of domestics and foreigns and tried a couple of new beers I had not ever heard of. Very, very pleased with this location and would return again.

Standard Cheesecake Factory set up. This one seems to be the best of the 3 or 4 in the Denver metro area.<br><br>More of a Spanish-fly dessert spot than place for a full meal. The food selection is massive but I think that&#39;s where they drop off in quality food wise, that&#39;s a lot of dishes for a cook to learn let alone master so I stick to the cakes.
I came here for my birthday dinner earlier today and had the worst waiter, his name was Justin he was very unprofessional and rude, I wish I had a better experience here.

My wife and I love the Cheesecake Factory. Most notoriously for their chocolate mousse cheesecake. It is absolutely our favorite. There are no locations located in the Springs so we decided to go check this out. The plaza was awesome, and extremely busy, as well as the restaurant. So it was understandable that it took a minute or so to be attended. <br><br>As time passes, we decided that we no longer want to sit in, since we stood there for over 5 minutes while nobody even walked up to take care of us. So I forced my way through to find someone to ask them for a to go order for cheesecake. They begin to take my order and ask me to wait. I sit and then end up waiting over 25min just to get 2 slices of cheesecake to go. This was absolutely absurd. All the while watching the staff stand around and clown with each other like they didn&#39;t have anything better to do, while I patiently sat there waiting for them to cut literally 2 slices of cheesecake.<br><br>The quality of the cake made it more or less worth the while, but I have never experienced such terrible customer service in any other Cheesecake Factory location I have ever visited. These guys really need to step it up.

Honestly, I&#39;ve been very upset with this restaurant lately as their service has been far from fabulous. My meal was fine but the service was just a disaster. Yesterday night we had to wait 15+ minutes for our waitress to collect our bill and I would understand if it was a busy Friday night but our server had a very empty section and was just focusing on one table of ladies that had just walked in, I went to the take out area to see if we could pay there and they said our server had to get it. It wasn&#39;t until another employee let out server know that we had gone up for her to then collect our card payment - but 15 minutes for a SLOWWWWW night? Really? Two weeks ago I was also there and it was the same issue, taking forever to collect our bill and we thought our server forgot about us! Service was great up until she forgot we were still there. <br><br>Pictures attached show a majority of the section where we were alone so no crazy amount of tables happening...

I don&#39;t send food back, I hold grudges. <br>Waitress was horrible. Took 20 minutes for a drink refill, she never came by to check on us. I would expect more when we were her only table. <br>Now the food.<br>Other than taking forever to come out, the cooks mixed up my wife and daughter&#39;s burgers. <br>My wife ordered her&#39;s well and my daughter medium rare. <br>They brought my wife&#39;s med rare and my daughter&#39;s well done. Wrong cheese on wife&#39;s also. My jambalaya was good. <br>We definitely won&#39;t be returning. <br>$100 down the drain. <br>Not too mention a 35 minute wait for a table <br>I do not recommend this place

Missing Appetizers but bloody bar napkin okay. <br><br>We have been to many Cheesecake Factory&#39;s around the world, but this location was very disappointing. We understand that the menu is very big with too many options, but it seemed like 75% of the items had mushrooms and half of those you couldn&#39;t take the mushrooms out.   <br><br>We ordered two sodas and two mixed drinks, all over priced. One of the two things that made us angry is we ordered an appetizer next, which we never received. After we received our main course we told our server, Santea, that we wanted to cancel our appetizer. She told us it was not her fault that the appetizer, Samosas ,takes so long.  <br><br>The thing that really made me angry is during 40 minutes of our hour meal, we watched as 18 servers walked over a bar napkin with blood on it, which 4 of them kicked it as they walked by, and finally one of them picked it up. <br><br>Never again will we eat here.

I&#39;m a veteran and I have never felt discriminated until today, thank you William Mickelson. Today is my niece&#39;s 16th Birthday Party, so we drove from Colorado Springs ( 1 hr away)  after being told no reservations (company policy)  and that there would be a 2 hour wait, so we left early to get our party (20) on the list..  To our surprise no wait, but had to wait for whole party before they would seat us.  After party arrived, host told us they could not keep party together(they had to separate us) wow!! Issue: We observe that they were taking reservations (What!!!!) Per picture 7 tables with 4 seats ( means 28 seats William) no one waiting to be seated, but we could not be accommodated because table were reserved ( again, no reservations), he was not sure of time or size of party, but he could not accommodate us.  I told him I was going Yelp him so he kick me and my party out..  spoke with GM Steve nice guy, but little to late. There is always two sides to a story, but believe me when I say stay away!!!! Goto Park Meadows (no one can afford to lose their  job, but he needs serious retraining)

It&#39;s a nice restaurant. We used to love it before but as of lately there service has not been good. We went to the one that is located is southwest plaza. We took some friends to have lunch and we ordered our food. Everyone got their food except me and our waiter said some how they didn&#39;t cook mine in time. By the time I got my food everyone in our party finished theirs and I had to pack my food to go. My husband was so pissed. The waiter didn&#39;t even have the decency to take my meal of the bill as way of saying sorry. Nothing was done!! I wish their customer service was better!! I don&#39;t know if I would want anyone to go through what we went. I would suggest just getting the cheesecake to go!!

Came in for happy hour dinner..place was clean, prompt service. Our waitress was friendly and helpful, had the salmon and potatoes, my daughter had the chicken fettuccine, my friend had the Brussel sprouts! Drinks and food were on point! Huge menu...this place has it all. Will def return.

It can be really hit or miss here.  On the positive side the food is usually pretty good but quality and service can be iffy.  <br><br>I had one experience where my burger was brought out to me and told they had to cook more fries and it would only take a few minutes.  By the time I finished eating my burger 10 minutes later my fries still hadn&#39;t been served to me. When the server finally bothered to check on us she asked, &#34;They didn&#39;t bring out those fries, did they?&#34; and finally went back to check.  Of course when they brought them out the fries were already cold from sitting back in the kitchen for 20 minutes.  Ok, so it was a bad day but got the burger comped.<br><br>Another time I had finished about three quarters of my burger and pulled out a piece of stringy metal.  It was a sliver from the grill brush.  Showed it to the waitress and the manager came &#34;groveling&#34; over head bowed apologetically.  Look, I know things happen but it still killed my appetite and at that point lunch was abruptly over.  Again they comped my meal.<br><br>Also there is some kind of dampening field in the building that blocks my mobile reception whenever I come here and the supposedly free mall wi-fi never seems to work.  <br><br>On the plus side they do have really delicious cheesecake and a wide selection of menu items to choose from but it&#39;s always a roll of the dice.  You have to ask yourself, &#34;Do I feel lucky?&#34;

Doesnt deserve even 1 star, should be a negative! Thought my family would try this location 1 more time after having a horrible experience 1 time before. Still hasn&#39;t changed. Hostess very unfriendly rolled eyes didnt know her job very well. Manager William Mickelson, doesnt know how to manage a large party of 17 for a birthday, he rather argue a point then try and fix it for the customers. My sisters 16th birthday was a mess. Choose a different location or another restaurant if you dont want a horrible services. Cant seat 17... why are all these tables open then? Last time I checked this table can be moved together to make room for a party.

SLOWEST Cheesecake Factory on Earth! This location doesn&#39;t compare with the rest of them. The food tastes great- but getting it is another story! Longest wait with approx. 22 EMPTY tables...and I mean, they&#39;ve been sitting empty for over 35 min with approx 42 customers waiting to be sat. I&#39;ve been here many times and it&#39;s always the same. The waiter or waitress always says &#34;I&#39;ll bring you fresh bread when it&#39;s ready, but there&#39;s none right now.&#34; Every. Single. Time. <br>Wait staff is not attentive to their tables the way they are in other Cheesecake Factories. I strongly feel corporate needs to visit and whip this new location into shape because their service is terrible and they move like turtles. I literally only come here because it&#39;s so much closer than the other CCF locations. :(

We love this place. Today was a special occasion for two of us. I asked the hostess for a full size booth for 4. She replied they only had a booth for 6 so I said we would take that. It was 1:00 and not all that busy. She then proceeded without comment to place us in a tiny booth for 2. Her English was not the best so when I questioned this I received a blank stare. I would have waited for a booth for 4. This was way above her pay grade. <br><br>The server and meal were excellent as usual, even accommodating my guest&#39;s special dietary request. I often bring guests here. The Cheesecake Factory in Highlands Ranch is much better, but we go here because it is closer. I expected a more gracious hostess. She may be trainable. I do not like to feel like I am interrupting their day.

I&#39;ve been to many other locations and frequently get the same dish. At this location I believe my husband and I received the lunch (half) portion for the price of the dinner portion. We asked our server about it and were assured it was the correct portion so buyer beware. Also, we ordered our cheesecakes to go and our server informed us that it disappeared like they could have been stolen or something which was strange but waited for another portion to arrive. Then my cheesecake didn&#39;t have the same garnish it normally has. Cheesecake Factory is great but this location needs improvement. Also, the service was very understaffed (they only had one stressed out server for the whole restaurant half an hour before dinner time.)
Have ordered from here a couple times Togo )through delivery service. <br>No fries with kids meal, no bread when selected. Consistent missing items making it very irritating to order.

The biggest Cheesecake Factory, right behind the Southwest Plaza mall. It&#39;s next to the Big 8 (Sports shop?) and there is to go parking as Always. I came in, literally the guy at the counter annoyed me, or maybe I get annoyed too quickly. None of these workers seemed happy to be there when I dined in that Friday night. Utter disappointment because the restaurant is super fancy looking compared to other locations I&#39;ve been to. Left promptly and don&#39;t plan on returning

Stale bread! Time and time again. This is especially true if you order food to pick up. The final straw was Sunday evening when I ordered the chicken and biscuits dinner to pick up, along with the meatloaf dinner. The meatloaf dinner comes with the same two rolls/bread that come with other dinners: a sourdough roll and a sweeter, dark colored roll.<br><br>If you want home security, just order a dinner that comes with rolls, then you can use the rolls as weapons. One strike in the head will knock any intruder out cold. <br><br>My sharpest knife could not cut through the sourdough piece. Even after nuking it, I still couldn&#39;t get a clean slice. I needed the canines of a wolf to bite through it.<br><br>The biscuits were not fresh. Even after nuking they crumbled instead of holding together as a fresh biscuit should.<br><br>I spoke to the manager Monday night. He didn&#39;t sound like he cared.  His tone was as though I was crazy. I was polite but firm in my complaint. He had a blase noncaring tone in his voice. Too bad I didn&#39;t get his name so I could print it here.<br><br>The Littleton Cheesecake Factory has also screwed up several of my pickup orders in the past. For example, the Cuban rolls are supposed to come with a mustard dip. Instead I got some strange white dip.<br><br>I&#39;ve had the mashed potatoes seven times. Only twice were they fresh. The other times they were hard, not soft and fluffy. Shame on the Littleton Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>For the price that Cheesecake Factory charges, it&#39;s a ripoff to have such a high occurrence of unsatisfactory experiences. <br><br>Why do I keep going back to Littleton Cheesecake Factory? Because the few times they get the order right and it&#39;s fresh, it&#39;s really good. However, this time was the last. I&#39;ve had it with the Littleton Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Yesterday evening at 7:15 I called from my car to place my order to pick up. I was transferred to that dept. For five minutes I heard music and finally hung up and called again. I said to the different person who answered that nobody had picked up on the transfer. She said it was really busy and transferred me again. Another five minutes goes by and I hang up. Third time, third person, same complaint. After five minutes it went through. So 15 minutes total. Unacceptable. Just how busy are the people at the front counter that they can&#39;t take my order? Whenever I&#39;m there, there is NEVER MORE than one party being waited on at that counter. So BS that they were so busy that I had to wait 15 minutes.

Offered to take my Mom to breakfast for her birthday, she chose this place. I figured it must be good because she has been here around 10 times since they opened and she is picky. <br><br>We went on a Sunday morning when they opened at 10AM.  No wait, friendly faces were ready to greet us. <br><br>Love the decorating in this place, it&#39;s gorgeous. We were sat at a roomy booth. They have a good selection to choose from for Breakfast and Brunch.  I ended up copying my Mom but wish I would have ordered the Eggs Benedict or an Omelette.  We ordered the two egg breakfast with bacon. She got the bagel with it and I ordered the english muffin with mine. <br><br>Eggs were cooked perfectly! For both of us. Bacon was good too. Potatoes were so dry, maybe overcooked?  Her bagel was good and my english muffin was huge and delicious. <br><br>Our server was friendly and good.

You get two stars because of Stacey the bartender and the guy backing her up, (Jason?).  They were literally the only decent part of this entire overpriced debacle.  I&#39;ve been here twice now and the first time it was fine.  I ordered their Evelyn&#39;s pasta, and being vegan, asked them to simply leave the cheese off and not cook it in butter as per the website.  No problem, done and done.  Ok, back again for a second try, as my better half wants a burger.  I order the same thing and she orders her burger on a different bread.  Ok, 5 minutes later our fill in waiter (for the waiter on break apparently) comes back to tell us the bread is shaped differently from the burger.  The burger is round and the bread is square.  Uh.  No problem.  After about five minutes of trying to fit a round burger on a square bun, we are informed we can order the other burger on the bread she wants or just take this burger on the bread it&#39;s on.  Fine, just get away from me so we can crack up.  Note, it&#39;s now been ten minutes and I have no wine I ordered.  About five minutes after, the waiter returns to tell me their &#34;head chef&#34; (quite a stretch) said the pasta isn&#39;t vegan.  I know. - That&#39;s why I said don&#39;t cook it in butter or put cheese on it.  The website says the pasta is vegan, try to keep up.  Ok, still don&#39;t have any wine and it&#39;s taken us explaining orders twice now.  Now I have a new waiter.  The IQ in this restaurant on average is remarkably low apparently.  I reorder my wine.  This Chianti sucks.  Whatever. About twenty minutes after our orders show up.  First thing I notice is my meal is literally half the size it was last time and sitting in a puddle of olive oil.  Both meals have been under the heat lamp for quite some time obviously.  I don&#39;t even have the heart to complain at this point.  My girl&#39;s burger is way undercooked.  I&#39;m a vegan and I can see it from here.  Her salad is spring mix and the side of dressing is legit bigger than the salad.  Shoot me.  It then took fifteen minutes to get a piece of cheesecake to go that I know is frozen.  Maybe if the meathead server would have spent less time trying to hit on my lady then it would have had decent service.  At this point I&#39;m not sure I even care about anything more than just getting the hell out of this restaurant.  I don&#39;t think we will be back ever.  Screw that.  This place feels amateur as hell.  <br><br>P.S. Now neither of us feel very good.  Ugh.

This place has the worst service ever!  So much happened between not taking our order, failing to tell us the pizza oven was broken 40 minutes into our night out there to dropping our food! I do not recommend this place nor the service it gives! Wish I could give this place 0 stars .

Food is amazing, service is usually great! I have been here many times but I&#39;m just going to review my most recent trip: we had a chicken Parmesan pizza and another chicken dish, both were amazing but definitely check out the chicken Parmesan pizza (you will not regret it). <br><br>Took a bit to get the food and bill but nothing major and the staff knew their stuff. Great place to try new things.

We enjoy getting dessert here!! I love looking at all the cheesecakes in the dessert case! I could spend 10-20 mins just looking. They do a good job here. This my favorite location in the Denver metro.

Took my Step-daughter to a belated Birthday dinner here. The server was top notch however the dinner was less than stellar. It&#39;s a chain restaurant and the attraction is the dessert. If the goal is a delicious cheesecake get your cake and leave. The dinner was over priced nothing less than $20 per dish, drinks $3.95 for ice tea, appetizers were $11 and the presentation and portion size not worth it. Should have eaten dinner first and stopped in for cheesecake later.

Such s fabulous meal on a Sunday!  We sat in the bar and devoured an order of crab balls while sipping on<br>fantastic cocktails. Next we had delicious chicken piccata and their delicious fresh bread. We ended the meal splitting a piece of scrumptious cheesecake. <br>Delightfully surprised at the great meal! We will be back! Oh! Our server, Heidi, was just fun, friendly and great fun!

We were there for lunch a little after it opened, and there was clearly a rush right at the opening of the restaurant and they did not appear to be ready. The service was slow because the waitress tried to hit all of her tables everytime she made her rounds, but she was friendly when doing so at least. She wasn&#39;t the only one not prepared though, because they were out of sourdough bread as well. This was a huge disappointment because besides the cheesecake, the sourdough bread is why we come to The Cheesecake Factory.
Best Cheesecake to go with the best service on this side of town! <br>Mango Key Lime is an all time favorite of mine.
DO NOT get the Mac n cheese burger it taste like a brick of salt, management was really good we really liked our server.

Food is alright.. I mean it&#39;s Cheesecake. Whenever we randomly feel lazy it is what it is. Always at the bar. Bartenders are either whacked out or just strange. They can&#39;t really keep bad ass tenders here let&#39;s be honest who wants to do that. <br><br>Went for dinner at the bar at 8:30 when closing is at 10. Drinks. Apps and food. Quick order. Quick eaters and know what we are doing.  In the biz so we wouldn&#39;t annoy anyone until hella late. <br><br>Whole experience is meh. It&#39;s beneath us to tip less than 20% but that&#39;s how we roll. Being in this business you just don do that. Even when service is subpar or worse. I wish bartenders took more pride in what they&#39;re doing. Only people at the bar. She only had service well. Mediocre shake.. soggy olives as if they climbed out of a strip club. Didn&#39;t check on apps. Didn&#39;t check on refills. Didn&#39;t try to up sell booze (what?) upon ordering a top shelf martini was offered a well.. actually attempted to down sell.... I mean.. what&#39;s next you&#39;re gonna talk someone out of a double on their first drink also? Come on. Just no urgency. No common sense in making money for a company you work for or for your own tip. Didn&#39;t check on entrees.. I went and got some shitty black table pepper myself from a high top. Cleared ourselves. Places Bev naps ourselves.. doing a ton of secret shopper visits for work this was really a joke. Also service that approaches with a sense of familiarity. Not friendliness just familiarities. So off putting. You can&#39;t expect everyone popped out of a sewer but the caliber of staff is below average at least every time I&#39;ve dealt with a bartender and especially this last Sunday. <br><br>Basically walked her through everything and bussed ourselves. Should have cooked. <br><br>Don&#39;t usually write reviews but this is just such a shame in our business people can be this unmotivated. <br><br>Sure enough manager comes behind the bar to check on nightly procedures and all of a sudden she&#39;s in tip top shape. The refills on sodas we didn&#39;t get and no offer on another round of alcoholic bevs, as we were waiting for to go bags and cc was long on top of the receipts.. we suddenly got acknowledged! She&#39;s offering us refills now! Dude, there&#39;s no on at the bar and we are waiting on our cc to be processed or acknowledged even. Too busy with closing the bar I guess.. whole hour before closing though. Oh my. So blatantly obvious and just dumb in nature. A manager is behind the bar. Big fuckin whoop. You should really take pride in what you do no matter who&#39;s behind you and their status. But that&#39;s where work ethic takes a different path. Some of us are not meant to kick ass and take names. Some are not high ringers. On a $60 tab $15 bucks when there&#39;s no one there should make a difference for someone that&#39;s working a pm shift. But maybe not. Sad thing is you add another round of drinks which we were clearly ready for.. shots before we went bowling and two desserts we wanted to grab but never got the menu and bam! That&#39;s your sales you should care about. That&#39;s your tip you should worry about. That&#39;s the work ethic and the skill you exercise on the daily by having this job.. it clearly isn&#39;t there. <br><br>Sometimes you&#39;re proud of managing bars. Sometimes you&#39;re proud of awesome nights you bartend. Then you go to Cheesecake and get this service and clearly observe the difference. <br><br>No reason to be back. What do people always come back for? The experience. The service. The way you make me feel. We all know it&#39;s surely not Cheesecakes &#34;exceptional cuisine&#34; that makes it happen. The experience is just not there. As for grabbing a cheesecake to go? Hell yeah. Peeps working that counter are rad and hella driven. Which is a lovely change from bartenders.

I just walked in this afternoon like around 4:30 and it was the worst service I have had in a while. I was told that the bar and the high tops where open seating. So me and my family sat down and waited for more then 10 minutes to ever get offered anything or get any menu&#39;s. We asked a shift manager if we had to go ask for a waiter she left and a waitress came up. But that waitress was standing at the host booth we asked why and she told us she was helping the other worker plan the evening. This isn&#39;t what we came in for we only wanted to eat dessert. After we got up the shift manager wanted to fix things but they weren&#39;t good solutions all would make us wait more. We are on our way to Park Meadows in wish of better service.

Unlikely to be a &#34;next time&#34; The problem wasn&#39;t inattentive staff, it was lousy staging by the kitchen. Meals were redone and served after appetizers were finished. Still left a &#34;bad taste&#34; of the experience.

2 hours of waiting, poor food cooked incorrectly and extremely slow service is why the Cheesecake Factory gets one star. No management presence I could see but when went to the restroom I saw 2 managers discussing some thing and never once saw any manager walking around greeting tables. How do you mess up a bacon bacon cheese burger? Ask the cooks at the Cheesecake Factory. I got mine with no cheese! The bacon was not smoked per their menu and there was a chunk, yes a chunk of bacon the size of a knuckle. Like a pigs knuckle. It was absurdly incorrect and just downright laziness of the kitchen. Service was so slow I could&#39;ve taken a nap.

I went to cheesecake for a late lunch with my family.<br><br>Our server was nice, but it was hard to get a hold of her. It was not that busy, but she did not check up on us often. We had to wait a while for her in order to get our check. <br><br>I ordered the shepherds pie and was not very satisfied. The gravy they used was too salty and there were enough mashed potatoes to mask the taste. There carbonara was also pretty oily as well.

This place is great. We were so excited when we learned that we would be getting our own Cheesecake Factory!  We have not been disappointed. The food is consistent, the staff has been great, and the menu has something for everyone. Some people complain about the length of the menu, but to us it&#39;s just more of a reason to go here. Great lunch specials. We will go back!
Good waiter on Sunday and all food was good despite the diversity available on the menu. Good trip for a party of seven, very surprised everything went so well

First off EXCUSE ME! Isn&#39;t the customer always right let&#39;s start off there. Feb 17th we arrived around 4:30 with a group of 20 for my cousins sweet 16th birthday dinner. Calling in before hand of course because who wouldn&#39;t make a reservation for a group of 20 ESPECIALLY since we are traveling from Colorado Springs so calling this morning as soon as they had opened we talked to Megan who said they don&#39;t allow reservations due to the company  policy. So we offered to put a card on file in case we no showed we understand saving that many seats for a possible no show is a lot of money lost. So okay we decided to send part of the group up earlier to get us on the list and when about 15/20 arrived they told us there was no wait we just needed to stay up front until the rest of the party arrived. This is where the JUICY STORY BEGINS! So we arrive as a birthday party so OBVIOUSLY we want to sit together and CELEBRATE! Well MR. WILLIAM MICKELSON had other plans he wanted to separate us into booths because well here is the kicker we couldn&#39;t sit together because the table where we could sit together was RESERVED. This guy wasn&#39;t willing to work with us and hearing out the fact we had tried to call more then just one time even once before we got into the car to drive here. He argued and and then towards the end told us he wasn&#39;t going to serve us and we had to leave. We got his business card and took a picture of the tables that he was reserving for 9 people who would have fit in the one booth he was trying to use to split us up in. I repeat do not go to to this place they have to common sense, decency, or even respect for there customers.
This place is just as you think. You come in, big menu, lots of cheesecake. I had the skinnylicious chicken pot pie and it was not skinnylicious tasting which was awesome!
Adored our waitress! She was the bomb. Forgot her name... or else would mention. Will be going back. Treated like family.

ROYALLY screwed up my daughters 18th birthday, away from family at college, and her group waited a very long time just to be seated, then another 40 minutes without so much as a water to drink! Wouldn&#39;t store an expensive cake it the fridge for the party, and eventually just left.  The girl felt bad enough being away from family as it was(we don&#39;t live in Colorado) and the complete lack of service is beyond excuse.  Your facility should be ashamed of yourselves.  The girls handled it better than I would have.

We&#39;ve had good luck here. <br><br>Bellagio chicken - a favorite, 5 stars<br>Steak Diane - 4.5<br>Chicken sliders - 4.5<br>Pit Dip Beef - 2.5 stars<br>Dynamite shrimp - 5<br>Chicken Piccata - 3<br>Orange chicken - 2.5

DON&#39;T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY AT THIS RESTAURANT.  The service sucks, and the food is sub-par.<br><br>I should have read the reviews before going to this restaurant.  Boy does it need some work.  It should be named something different because most cheesecake factories are so much better.  <br><br>We had a party of 12, and waited 1 hour and 20 minutes for our order.  One of our members didn&#39;t even get her food, they didn&#39;t put in the order.  I ordered fish and chips, and got burned fish nuggets.  <br><br>The management doesn&#39;t care what food they put our there, or having to remake something.  The restaurant should be closed down.

Visited the new Cheesecake factory in the southwest plaza mall today. Service was quick and professional. The bistro shrimp pasta was pretty good but I wouldn&#39;t order it again. Crab dip appetizer was amazing and keylime pie cheesecake definitely makes me want to go back!

The corporate office from Cheese Cake Factory would be embarrassed if they saw the way their restaurant was ran today and the way the manager treated us.  We arrived with our group of 8 when they opened today.  They may have had 2 or 3 small tables of people just getting sat at the same time as we did.  We all agreed our sweet waitress did an excellent job of trying to get it right.  She was at the mercy of the kitchen and manager.  She appolgized and said if she had the power she would have made it right. We tipped her well and not on the quality of food or the poor interaction with the manager (Paul).   It took over an hour and twenty minutes for our food to start to make it to the table.  We ordered within 5-10 minutes of sitting at the table.   It was obvious that at least 3 of the meals had sat for estimate 20 minutes and cold.  Cheese wasn&#39;t even melted on the hamburger that was ordered.  The manager made ZERO attempt to correct the meals or make it right.  The manager was obviously in a bad mood.  He was observed throwing things in the kitchen.  To avoid any further negative action with the manager 3 of  us went without.  Not going to be a manager very long in any restaurant or business with that attitude Paul. WOW

Service was extremely slow and the manager who came by to apologize for the wait almost seemed like it was a drag for him to go to each table and explain what was going on I wish I would&#39;ve saw the reviews beforehand! <br>The staff were standing around talking amongst eachother, not paying attention to their tables at all:[ <br>The one star is for the 2 servers behind the cheesecake  who helped me get a couple slices to go! They were attentive and so friendly!

Interminable wait for good food.<br><br>We tried to call for reservations because we had a group of 8 but this location wouldn&#39;t take them. Instead, we were told to get there early and there would be no problem. This was a birthday lunch for my wife.<br><br>We arrived at 11:15 for the 11:30 opening. Our group was third in line, behind two couples. The doors were opened promptly at 11:30 and we walked to the receptionist station. We were told that they couldn&#39;t help us there, to go to the other station. The other station was 6 feet away behind the same counter. <br><br>We were told to go stand by the cheesecake display case and wait. Other groups were being seated, including 2 different groups of 7. One of us went to the counter and asked when we would be seated and were told that we would be seated as soon as possible. <br><br>Finally, at 11:45 we were taken to a corner booth. We ordered and then began the wait. Bread came...another batch of bread came...our drinks were refilled. No food.<br><br>I was getting ready to go ask about our meals when a meal was delivered. Great, I thought, here comes our food. This was at 12:30. We had been there for an hour and one of us had a meal.<br><br>No other meal showed up. After five minutes (12:35) my meal came. So 2 of us had meals, but politely waited for the others. At 12:40 two salads came out. Then the rest of the meals showed up.<br><br>So we started eating about 12:45...an hour after we were seated and one and a quarter hours after we walked into an empty restaurant.<br><br>We finished eating and were presented with the bill. We were never asked if we wanted dessert, just given the bill and we left the restaurant at 1:30.<br><br>This may have been the slowest service I have ever experienced.
I tried contacting management like the person who responded to my review said to, with zero response back. They truly don&#39;t care.

Delicious food. Long wait times and I&#39;ve gotten sick after the 3 times of eating different food there. Something isn&#39;t right. My husband refuses to eat there because he gets stomach problems after the last 2 times he has gone.

The restaurant was busy (prom night) but we got in quickly without reservations. Our waitress seemed to disappear for longer periods than I&#39;m used to, but it was pretty busy! The food was delicious!! I had the lasagna verde, which is spinach lasagna noodles made in house. The kids had fettuccine Alfredo and loved it too! And of course the cheesecake selection had something for everyone.

The Littleton location was disastrous. The service was extremely slow as usual, the server was inexperienced, and several tables in her section had issues. On a slow Tuesday night, we waited over 25 minutes for our food only to have the manager come over to say the nachos were overcooked and the burger was under cooked so they were now making them from scratch. Total wait time for food was 42 minutes!!! When the bill came, the food that the manager said he would take off, wasn&#39;t - and I had to find the server to even get the bill in the first place. This was the second time in a row that we have had issues with food and service. We will not be returning.

I don&#39;t usually give bad reviews, but I have to say something this time.<br><br>We came to this Cheesecake Factory in hopes of a nice meal. The wait was over an hour, so we decided to order food to go. They said it&#39;d be about 25 minutes, which was fine. The girl who took our order was friendly and courteous. Great! So we waited.<br><br>After about 35 minutes, I went to check on the food. Apparently the people taking orders don&#39;t speak to one another because the lady at the register didn&#39;t have any record of our order because &#39;the other girl must have helped you&#39;. Seriously? So they found the girl who took our order and after looking for a few minutes, she found our food stuffed on a shelf behind the register. Again, Seriously?!<br><br>So we took our food, home and big surprise, it was cold. Not like room temp cold, almost like it had been refrigerated cold... We were hungry so I nuked my and my husband&#39;s entrees. We ate the food. Mine was still not warm after 2 minutes in the microwave, so I gave up. The only thing good about our order was the cheesecake.<br><br>To put the cherry on top of a bad experience, I got a nice dose of food poisoning from my dinner, so for 12 hours, I was in agony, with vomiting, dry heaves and terrible, sharp stomach cramps? Once I recovered, I did call to let the manager know and he told me that the dish I had, the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, was a very popular dish and he hadn&#39;t had any other reports of food poisoning. It kinda felt like he was telling me it wasn&#39;t their fault. But after not eating all day, having that reheated/cold meal and then 4 hours later being stuck with my head in the toilet, it kinda seems like that food probably was the culprit.<br><br>Sorry, Cheesecake Factory, this was an experience I just can&#39;t get over. We won&#39;t be back.

If I could I would give 1/4 of a star. 4 brunch plates ordered. 2 of them missing part of the meal 1 made incorrectly the other one lost and finally came out with burnt eggs and in toasted bread. Manager seemed unapologetic and comped 1 of the meals.. Should have comped half of them if not all of them. We almost walked out on our check <br><br>It is sad we love cheese cake factory but this performance is very horrible. Blamed on &#34;food inspection&#34;

Horrible service and management is clueless. I truly believe that when you receive bad service it is not the servers fault it is the managements fault, as a GOOD manager you should be touching the tables and assisting your servers when there in need of help. There is no reason why the manager was on the expo line when it wasn&#39;t busy, The management team should be checking on the guest, cleanliness of the restaurant and making sure her staff is up to standards. <br><br>Get this restaurant up to standards..

I just left the ModMarket place to stop off at the Cheesecake Factory to pick up an order for a retirement party at where I work. It is a large Godiva chocolate cheesecake that has chocolate mousse in the middle. They have a lot of wonderful dinner plates at the Cheesecake Factory. The first time I was there I had corn fritters and blackened catfish while my friend had a medium rare ribeye steak. This location in Littleton is fairly new and is welcomed around here.

Very disappointed! The cheesecake factory has gone downhill. I was in a party of six that came in to have a late lunch last weekend. The restaurant itself was maybe half full and we were told since we were not on the list that we would have to wait 30 minutes. That 30 minutes turned into an hour and 15 minutes. We finally got our table and it took another 45 minutes to get our lunch which was average at best. The wait staff was very lackadaisical and didn&#39;t seem to care about the customers at all. They seemed more concerned about gossiping amongst each other rather than taking care of paying customers. After that four hour ordeal, I will never eat at cheesecake factory again and I will make sure that everyone I meet knows this story as well.
Service is the only issue with this location, but that also depends on who your server is. Food is always fine.

Went for dinner.  As we were seated at our table the server was delivering drinks to the table next to us and accidentally dropped a full cup of milk on the floor which splashed up and soaked my husband&#39;s leather shoe and leg &amp; another person at our table.  Waiter said sorry &amp; continued waiting on us.  We thought a manager would have come over but we never saw a manager thru the entire meal.  The waiter dropped the check on the table,  said he&#39;d take it when we were ready and left...  when he returned to pick it up we then asked  the waiter if he was going to address the spilt milk issue,  the manager came to the table, we told him what happened, his reply was &#34;thanks for bringing this to my attention I&#39;ll use this as a coaching experience&#34;. Didn&#39;t offer to comp my husband&#39;s meal,  buy us dessert,  nothing, just left the table.  It was a Saturday night at 9pm and the restaurant was empty &amp; now we know why..  with many restaurants to choose  from we as well will take this as a &#34;coaching experience&#34;. We don&#39;t usually cry over spilt milk but seriously... Hasta la vista

Arrived for brunch and hardly crowded at 11:30 am on a Sunday. Should have been my first red flag. Server was nice enough. But we waited 30 minutes to arrive cold. The chiquiles and the eggs on top were cold and the other dish presented was incorrect. When they brought the correct dish it was cold. The eggs had cheese shreds that weren&#39;t even melted and my &#34;crispy&#34; bacon showed up almost raw. We had appointments for the day and didn&#39;t have time to wait another 30 minutes for fresh hot food to arrive. Didn&#39;t even take a bite. Three $3 on table for 1 cup of coffee and were asked to &#34;wait&#34; another 5 minutes for the manager to have the audacity to walk over and try to tell us he &#34;had our bill&#34; for inedible food we didn&#39;t eat a bite of. Was planning to take home a pumpkin cheesecake for holidays and now I have to rethink dessert as this left a terrible taste in my mouth and we won&#39;t be back.

We had a great experience when we came here for &#34;date night&#34;. Our waitress was wonderful and made our dinner a ton of fun. I ordered a meal from the lighter menu and it was the perfect size and delicious. We ordered cheesecake and although it was good, it was extremely rich and far too large for the 2 of us. We were only able to eat a little bit of it. Overall a great experience!

This used to be my favorite place close to our neighborhood to eat.  We would go at least once or twice a month.  Last visit the service was terrible, and the food was still good.  This visit, a birthday celebration, was a DEAL BREAKER...there was a hair in our bread...long and twisted/baked in the loaf.  At the same time we find the hair, the food had just been dropped and one dish was room temperature.  They did replace the dish and no charge and a free cheesecake for the birthday girl.  I guess I should be happy about that, but I wanted them to acknowledge they were clearly having problems and the kitchen - and I wasn&#39;t looking for something for free.  I just felt like they were comping the food and brushing the issue under the rug. To make things worse - my daughter forgets her bag from shopping and calls like 3 minutes after we leave.  They tell her it is not there, after she gives them our table number...2 minutes later her step-dad gets back and goes to the table...the bag is right there...ugh.

Went there tonight to pick up a Togo order from doordash. Arrived a little early and let the Togo counter cashiers know that I am there to pick up an order, and they informed they would let me know when the order was ready. No problem at all. I sat down patiently as I watched 4 other customers eventually get helped and was the last person there waiting for my order. The original two cashiers were still there as well as a third cashier who showed up later who did not know of my situation. <br><br>After patiently waiting about 20 minutes past pick up time, about 30 minutes total wait, I finally go up to the counter myself to let them know that I am waiting for my order. The new cashier looks at me and with an clear attitude to start off with and says &#34;Well IIII didn&#39;t know anyone was here for doordash&#34; with very apparent attitude in his voice, so I say to him &#34;Well I informed the two previous cashiers that I was here, and they told me that they would let me know. But yes, I&#39;m STILL waiting for my doordash order.&#34; I would not have responded that way if there hadnt been that look of disdain on his face and voice to start off with.<br><br>After my response he then proceeds to aggresively put his hands on the counter as if trying to intimidate me and leans towards me and told me not to give him attitude. Clearly he had a problem with me from the start before I had even decided to give him my initial lippy  response.<br><br>Granted I look like a 20 something years old, when in reality I am 30 years old, so I feel this guy got on his macho guy attitude on because he thought some kid was trying to make him look foolish. <br><br>I&#39;m sorry but I am not some child that he can reprimand or tell me how to react to his intimidation so I just said, &#34;Are you fucking kidding me?&#34; In response to his intimidation tactics. If you are going to put your hands in a defiant manner on the counter and treat me as if I&#39;m a child, of course I will defend myself. He then proceeds to ask me &#34;You gonna cuss at me?! What are you going to do about it? He was clearly trying to get a reaction out of me and yes it worked. So I told the cashier &#34;I&#39;m a grown man and can cuss if i choose and fuck you&#34; and walked out the store. I then proceeded to call the manager of the store to explain what happened, and she keeps on saying I&#39;m sorry if something happened to make me have a bad day? Uh yea you&#39;re cashier is ptententious ass. But by then I was so frustrated and was seeing red from being mistreated that most of my conversation with her was nothing but curse words. Been delivering from DD for two years. NEVER had an encounter like this one.

After leaving my review the corporate offices of the Cheesecake factory left an apology for the bad food. I did read other reviews just to find the same kind of issues I had and also noted, the Cheesecake factory apologizes to the guest but the problems continue. Apologizes are great but they need to be backed up with the changes you promised to make.

Happy to have a Cheesecake Factory on this side of town.  The extensive menu makes it a great place to go when no one can decide what type of food they want.  There are also some great &#34;skinny&#34; items for those who are watching their figure, so that they can binge on cheesecake later.<br><br>Very nice decor, as all Cheesecake Factories have.  The lighting is a bit on the dark side, in my opinion, but not bad.  Staff are friendly and attentive.  Service is fairly fast.  This was my third attempt at dining here, as my previous 2 attempts failed due to the long waits on weekend nights (1+ hour).  <br><br>We started with an appetizer - the Tex Mex Eggrolls. They were outstanding.  I got the barbecue ranch chicken salad and it was huge - definitely you could split this with 1-2 other people.  It was also delicious.  Topped the meal off with a slice of red velvet cheesecake, but couldn&#39;t eat the whole thing due to the bread and appetizers earlier.<br><br>Overall, this location is at the same quality as you would expect from The Cheesecake Factory and it is a great option for those in this part of town.

I would give this place 5 stars because of the food! But the service is what brings it down. We have had great service here once, but the last 3 times the service was just &#34;ok&#34; and the host staff wasn&#39;t very friendly. If they could get there service better this place would be perfect.

We opted to try the new Southwest Plaza location on this visit and I have to say I do enjoy the layout much more than the downtown location.  I had the chicken Bellagio on this visit and could not have been happier.  It was cooked very nicely but the portions are just so huge!  Great value in that for $17 you basically have two meals.  I had the leftovers for lunch the next day.  Of course I had cheesecake for dessert....this time opting for the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake.  The wait considering this restaurant is new to the area was not bad.  We were quoted 20 minutes and it was about spot on.  Give this location a shot if you&#39;re in the mood for The Cheesecake Factory trademark but don&#39;t want to drive down to Denver.

My previous review -- it was a little uninformed, I&#39;ll admit. Not only have I been educated on how several main dishes (besides the cheesecake) are here, I&#39;m underwhelmed for sure.<br><br>I have a friend who works at this restaurant. With that come a myriad of free dishes she receives. She happens to love it, which is odd because we have very close palettes. We love the same foods/flavor combinations. However, the main dishes here are just SO bland. <br><br>Thinking back, I&#39;ve also always been really let down by the food here. It&#39;s fine, but nothing special. Especially when you&#39;re dropping over $150 on a special occasion. That much money makes you want to keep your head down and just eat it to justify the marginal main courses. <br><br>Having to put salt on food in such an &#34;upscale place&#34; is weird and embarrassing. At both locations, I&#39;ve been very unimpressed. They pastas need way more garlic, the sauce is so vague tasting. The chicken is usually dry and flavorless, and everything else is almost a tease of the potential. Most of the cheesecake is good. Stick to the light fluffy ones. The dark chocolate rich type is a stroke waiting to happen. <br><br>My only theory is that this is an American themed place, so the average American person will complain if it has too much flavor. <br><br>Just a guess, but it&#39;s sad.

Would give no stars if I could. Manager tonight really needs more training and if this is how he acts with the clientele I can only wonder what he lets go on back of the house. You have to be able to fill requirements that older, disabled people have and definitely not turn around and tell them &#34;it was their fault&#34; that their wait was almost two hours <br>Unbelievable <br>I am sure good people work here but this person&#39;s behavior was atrocious and taints our entire experience! <br>I am leaving a good deal out of this review. If you eat here I hope everything goes well!

As a vegetarian I appreciate the options and I love the fit/skinny menu. They have an awesome vegetarian burger and the avocado toast/bread for an appetizer is delicious. THe service is decent, can sometimes be a little slow. Overall I&#39;ve not had a bad meal there.

Honestly the food was delicious. I&#39;m a 6 foot tall full grown man and the portions were ridiculous. Just way to much food. However that would be the least of our problems. In a half full restaurant it took our server 16 minutes to acknowledge my wife and I. It would take 10 more minutes to actually get our drinks. We had to practically beg for bread for the table. The food came out at a reasonable time, however we were lucky we didn&#39;t require anything else for the table because once again our server was no where to be found. While we ate the couple at the next table we&#39;re getting refunds and apologies for the exact same problems. Lol. We would never see our server again until the time to pay. <br> We ate here about a year ago when it first opened and received the exact same treatment but chalked it up to a new staff. We gave it some time and finely went back to give it a second chance. Because of this decision I now question a lot of decisions I&#39;ve made over the years. Lol. <br>  I&#39;ll get it to go from now on. Save 3 hours and 80.00. <br>This locations service gets 0 stars!

Too busy, slow service,  three servers no communication, took 45 minutes to get appetizer so they told us it was going to be taken care of (wasn&#39;t, still on bill) almost 4 dollars for coke refill? The $14 chips called nachos weren&#39;t good at all however the dinner portions were good sized and tasty but arrived over 1 hr after being seated. We arrived at 7:30 We&#39;re seated at 8 but were late for 10pm movie cross the street.  Good thing the daughters b-day is only once a year

Went there to celebrate a family occasion. Had five people total. They serve the food one by one. So the first person was almost halfway through eating before everyone else was served.  Very disappointing.
Went here for lunch on Saturday. Service was slow. Food was ok. My breakfast Monte cristo was soggy.

The Cheesecake Factory is really a place where you can&#39;t go wrong, BUT, this location specifically is so dramatically hit or miss. Mostly miss, to be blunt. This review is for the locations specifically. The last two times I have gone we have sat and waited at least 10 minutes to even be acknowledged by the waitstaff, none the less to get drinks (not even alcohol, just water or soda), then bread, then order food, then get the food. Each of these steps always has at least 10 minutes between, you order 4 waters and wait 10 minutes to get them, then the waitstaff disappears for another 10ish minutes and comes back with bread then disappears while you&#39;re sitting there for 15 minutes ready to order, and so on. I don&#39;t expect much, but both times we have contemplated getting up and leaving because we were sitting there waiting with empty glasses and no bread and no one to take our order or even acknowledge our existence. It&#39;s disappointing for a place that&#39;s usually considered a &#34;nice&#34; place to go!

Met a friend tonight for happy hour at 5pm. The 2 female bartenders provided horrible service. We sat there with empty glasses most of the time.  They were busy washing and stacking glasses and chatting but ignoring most people sitting @ the bar.  I&#39;ve been here before for HH Monday through Thursday and that male bartender is fantastic.  He could certainly give these women a lesson in customer service.

This place is a bad joke! Worst restaurant experience I&#39;ve had in years!! Too start we were served water in scratched plastic mugs with water marks and specks of food. Me and two people I was sitting with had to ask for new mugs. My second mug was also speckled with food. My dad got fed up and went to the bar to get me a PROPER GLASS from the bar and a to go cup for my brother. My silverware consisted of a rusted spoon and water marked fork and knife speckled with food. A table next to us had a wobbly table leg bieng propped up by a MENU. That&#39;s right a MENU ON THE GROUND HOLDING UP THE TABLE.<br><br>On to the service. Staff was dismissive and curt. No smiles and and appeared to spend more time caking their face with 1/4&#34; of makeup than polishing silverware. The manager was polite, but very curt as well and when I tried to find him about the silverware my waitor tried to yank it out of my hand and told me I had been &#34;doing nothing but complaining all night&#34;. REALLY?! My mom had to ask twice for a glass of wine and my dad had to get up and go to the bar to get water.<br><br>The food. My dad&#39;s tuna was tough and served with tomatoes that did not have the brown stem part cored out. I worked at einstiens for 10/hour and would not dare serve a tomato like this. Plates had wipe marks and saucy hand prints from the &#34;cooks&#34;. Even though ordered at the same time, his came out before the before the rest and eventually was sent back. WOW

Absolutely horrible management and kitchen. Food took an hour to arrive and was cold. Manager comped 2 meals but didn&#39;t remake them so 2 people in our group left without eating. Unacceptable!!!!! We certainly won&#39;t be back.

55 minute wait drove us right back out the door. I&#39;ll never understand why I keep giving CCF second chances. <br>On top of that, there was a second line right at the door where they where hocking gift cards that was blocking the entrance, and my inevitable escape. <br>Also, the parking sucks.

This is your typical Cheesecake Factory chain, recently added on to the newly renovated Southwest Plaza. The decor inside is consistent with the rest of the chains--a mix of seemly random but ornate styles of furniture, lighting, and art.<br><br>Service was prompt, food was good. Their dark brown bread is still the best part of the meal and something I wish I could make at home.<br><br>Only real complaint is that it still has the new, plasticy smell permeating the restaurant. Not exactly something that whets the appetite.

Just finished a delicious meal at The Cheesecake Factory Southwest Plaza. Had my usual, Thai lettuce wraps that were excellent. Husband had the Spicy Cashew Chicken which I highly recommend. What really stood out is how incredibly nice our server Scott was. Not only was he super friendly but extremely efficient. One of the best servers I have ever had. Thank you Scott for the excellent service.

Dropped in to check out the mall renovations and decided to eat here. Been to several cheese cake factories and this one doesn&#39;t disappoint. We had the kids at a table in the bar area. Tons of staff on hand. There was no wait and ended up ordering the avocado egg rolls for an app. Came out quickly and then the kids pizza was ready. We had the Jamaican black pepper shrimp and finished with the Carmel salt cheese cake. We&#39;ll surely be back.

If I could give 0 I would! First time in about 5 years going to one of these chains. We live close and wanted to try something new, never again will we go back here. 11.50 to 12.50 for a drink you can&#39;t taste any alcohol in. For two of us we spent over 110 in under and hour! Waited 15 mins for a second round of drinks. The food is ok, waaaay to big of portions! Our waitress smelled of smoke not only when we sat down but every time she came to our table, we would ask her what she suggested and basically got it&#39;s all good. The tacos I ordered had a sweet cabbage that wasn&#39;t listed on the ingredients and did not taste good with tacos. The bread was hard as a rock. 11.50 for 4 fried mac and cheese bites! An appetizer for two? Seems pricy. We could have gone to the melting pot for close to this price. <br>Please don&#39;t waste you time here, go something worth the price!

I absolutely love The Cheesecake Factory. I am never disappointed.  This time I tried The Chicken Medira. The menu stated it was the most popular dish. I wondered how I had never tried it before.  The mushroom Medira sauce was heaven. I was hooked at the first bite.  The service was great. The portions huge so there is plenty of leftovers for tomorrow. I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

I would say that 2 1/2 stars is what this place deserves. It gives me about half of what I expected. The cheesecake factory used to be awesome it&#39;s gone downhill over the last few years and the new one at Southwest Plaza is no exception. The quality of the food, the service, just the whole experience overall. I always try to give them another chance but I don&#39;t think I&#39;m giving them any more chances...

The staff was amazing...I&#39;ve never actually eaten at this facility...i was working on a job site in the parking lot and went into a hypoglycemic low and walked in and the gentleman at the counter quickly got me a soda to help being my sugar back up.  Ky was the guys name and he was very helpful.  He didn&#39;t even question me when i stumbled in acting almost drunk...if you don&#39;t know someone has hypoglycemia one would assume the person is drunk or on druids or something but ky was very nice and quick and didn&#39;t even charge me for the soda.  Thank you very much.

The management of this restaurant is stunningly arrogant. Their food is below mediocre. Service is normally below average or worse. We have eaten there for the last time. We will not be ripped off again. Absurd that when they respond to these comments they just refer you to their website and to wait a few days. Better customer service at Waffle House . Avoid this location

Jess was our server tonight and she was wonderful! Made sure that we were always taken care of but wasn&#39;t constantly at our table either. The food was delicious as usual- loved the stuffed mushrooms! The only thing I don&#39;t love is that the cocktail prices aren&#39;t on the menu so my drink was more expensive than I thought it would be. Drink was still good though!

Pretty disappointed.  Maybe they have issues staffing the kitchen?  45 minutes wait on food.  Waiter kept coming by apologizing and saying &#34;it&#39;s coming right out&#34;.  Not until we got manager on duty was their issue explained.  I get things happen, but all the wait staff look super harried and stressed.  Wound up asking to have food bagged up to take home.  Manager comp&#39;d some cheesecakes and those were good. <br>But, I&#39;m telling you as if this review posting, avoid this place for now till they unscrew themselves.  Too many dining options around here to deal with this.

Ate here twice in the moth of December, only because we had gift cards to use.  Worst service, food, experience both times.  If you want a good Cheesecake Factory experience go to the one at Park Meadows.

Floors were very dirty when we got to our table but was eventually cleaned up. Had the carbonara. Had a good sauce with it at the bottom of the dish.  The pear martini is really unbelievable, rich and very fruity. I always get the Godiva cheesecake for dessert. Overall a good place to go when there is no other place to go.

Someone please explain to me why people eat at places like this. I just don&#39;t get it. Why go to a restaurant knowing before you walk in that the food is going to be average at best? Is it because the portions are big? Have we really gotten to that point where we&#39;re that big of pigs? No way. There is absolutely no reason in hell to ever eat at the cheesecake factory. I took my family and ended up spending $160. I&#39;m still not sure how. It would&#39;ve been lousy at half that price.

Rotten avocado served on my $13 chicken sandwich.  I showed my server and she didn&#39;t take my plate away or apologize but agitated said she would bring me a few slices of avocado.  I guess she just is not familiar with avocado in that when it is past its prime it is no longer firm but mushy and liquid in that the rotten remains were all over the rest of the produce and baked into my chicken.  In addition, I waited for over five minutes to even get my non-rotten slices so at that time my food was cold and soggy.  I&#39;ve been to all of the surrounding Cheesecake Factories many times and this particular restaurant clearly shows its lack of training.

Received the worst service in my life here waitress could have cared less about us ordered drinks after sitting there for 15 min . I would understand if busy but we were one of maybe 5 tables in whole place . Tried to order cheese cake and took almost an hour before we got that asked for bill when we got that but had to wait another 30 mins cause waitress was busy talking to table of friends behind us whole time . Never will I go back there again worst place ever . Talked to manager who said would give refund still waiting almost month later . Guess they don&#39;t care eithier

My kids love this place, so we&#39;ve given it a few tries now. Tonight was our last, at least for this location. We called from the mall to see what the wait was, and were told 30 minutes. When we walked in 2 minutes later, they said it was actually 55-75 minutes. After waiting 80 minutes, we were finally sat. Unfortunately, they were 0 for 4 on our meals. Kid&#39;s food didn&#39;t come out until 10 minutes after adult&#39;s food. When it did come out, it was so salty as to be inedible. My white chicken chili was cold, and my husband&#39;s food tasted off. We told the server we&#39;d like to pay for our drinks and apps and leave. To her credit, the manager did not charge us for anything. This is on top of a couple prior disappointing visits, so we will no longer be patronizing this location.

The cheesecake factory is one of are top places to go out to but i have to say that it is going down hill. i came with a party of four i ordered the eggplant parm. Ten minutes later the manager came out told me they only had two eggplant instead of three i said it was fine and went back to waiting for my food 15 minutes latter the food came out but not my order 15 after is finally came out everybody was already almost done with <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftheirs.my&amp;s=7ff76e42b0fe9f431aa9665198a0560bcafddd2c378779be80c36df3485f6a72" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">theirs.my</a> eggplant wasn&#39;t even fully cook .when paying he didn&#39;t give use back our creditcard so we thought we lost it had people help us look for it for it to be in the waiiters apron .

Was not really busy, we were told 5 minute wait , which was longer.. no biggie.  Sat down and waited 15 minutes for no waitress to acknowledge us.  The family next to us stated they had already been waiting over an hour for their  food.  Clear indication to leave, so we did.

Cheesecake Factory has a great menu and the food is good. The service is lacking and needs improvement. Recently ordered a burger which was took in excess of 25 minutes until I inquired about the timing. I was told that well done burgers took longer, a fair retort. When the burger showed up after 30 minutes it was rare! No apologies, just a promise to cook another one which showed up in 10 minutes. I have noticed slow service a couple of time now at this location. Expect more from this chain. Stay on top of your servers!!!!
Love their apps: spinach dip is my favorite, love the large green chilis in the quesadilla, and fried chicken sliders are tasty and filling. Always great service !

The Cheesecake Factory has great food, not just desserts! Our waitress was spunky and so much fun. I love the variety of options in the menu. I love having my birthday party at the Cheesecake Factory, who needs regular cake!

Just went this past weekend and the food was great, and that cheesecake, well its what they are known for, right?  It was good too.<br>The wait was over 90 minutes which for the Saturday night before Christmas- at the mall- well Ok, I can see that being a reason. <br>It would be great if they took dinner reservations, because their bar area is very small and there wasn&#39;t really a place to hang out while you wait, even if you did want a drink.<br>I did see the patio area-but being winter time, well--I&#39;ll just have to try it again in the summer to see if that helps take some of the crowded area issues out the picture.<br>But if you are looking for good food - this is a good place to eat.  I will be going back.

No bread... no avocado rolls... took 10 minutes to have a waitress to come take our order. This place was doing well when they first opened. Guess there&#39;s too many unsatisfied customers that they only had one waitress. Horrible birthday experience.  Food wasn&#39;t well prepared sat in our table for about 5 minutes and left. Pumpkin pie cheesecake was great that&#39;s the only reason for a positive star.

A visit to the Cheesecake Factory used to mean a special occasion, because of the varied menu, great service, and tasty food. We, too, were excited about the Cheesecake Factory coming to our area. What a huge disappointment.<br>We&#39;ve given them sooooo many chances to change our minds, and they keep failing, failing, failing - on all levels.<br>The food is sub-par, over seasoned (even the kids&#39; plates), and greasy. You have to beg for bread and butter when you order to go and still don&#39;t get it. Their attitudes reek of apathy.<br>When we have ordered to go online, we have called to ensure they have gotten our order correctly. Even with this over-kill and their arrogant assurance that they will get it right - they have gotten it all wrong, time and time again.<br>We finally contacted a manager, who promised to send a $20 gift card for recompense (even though we spent over $50 for another messed-up family meal). Weeks later we got the gift card...... <br>Guess what? Went to use the gift card today (why did I do this - meal was horrible!!), and it was for $10. Even the manager can&#39;t get it right!<br>An organization is reflective of its leaders .... it is apparent that a completely NEW management team needs to come in and clean house from the bottom up. Hoping this newer restaurant will be able to get their act together before it&#39;s too late.<br>PS - I do not need a response from the management. Won&#39;t do any good.

If this my first experience with eating at Cheesecake Factory  it would  have been my last. The food left much to be desired small portions, very greasy, lack of flavor and definitely way over priced for what we received.The service was very slow and  waitress had to be reminded  of  items ordered and we did not received. Though waitress was friendly. We had to return one of our meals to be prepared  over  &#34;it was horrible&#34; per my teenage son that never complains about food except for when  eats everything and wants more. My whole family had stomach aches that night and the excite next day. I called to speak to a manager and was left on hold for over 13 minutes and never was able to speak to a manager. In my opinion if you live the Cheesecake Factory or want to try it for the first go to the one down town  I have always had a good experience at that location.i won&#39;t go back to this location again,

Yeah, we went on Saturday for lunch, the place had maybe 5 tables total that had people eating, I ordered a Burger Medium which took 25 mins to come out. I cut into the Burger and it&#39;s raw on the inside, I wait 10 more mins for the server to come back to fix the issue, and after 25 more mins for the new burger, the server tells me it will be a few more mins do I want it go? Hell to the no on that. This place sucks, and The Cheesecake Factory lost a customer forever now. Also no sorry from the Manger, I feel bad for the server she did her best.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever dealt with. We have used Door Dash 3 times to deliver their food and Cheese Cake Factory had messed up the orders every time!!!! They made a breakfast burrito when we ordered the regular burrito.  We ordered shrimp and got salmon instead. Had been waiting another time for our food to be delivered from Door Dash, and when it was taking forever, we contacted Door Dash and they told us that the order never got acknowledged at the Cheesecake Factory!!!  Had called at an earlier time and spoke to a manager of Cheese Cake to complain about the burrito, but he had no customer service skills, as all he could say was it&#39;s Door Dashes problem.  He never apologized or said they would re-make the order!!!!  <br>We have been to the one downtown and at Park Meadows, and they are both great! But this one at Southwest Plaza is HORRIBLE!!!!!

That was the worst birthday dinner that I ever had in my life. I always went the cheese factory at park meadow mall; but they opened a new one at southwest plaza. Therefore, I planned my birthday dinner over there; but it was so so so upset me. First, the food was made wrong. Second, service was awful. Third, after I talked to the manager and he had done nothing. Forth, after I talked to manager, everyone acted differently. The waitress had to leave because her ride was here and she didn&#39;t want to spend money for Uber. The bus boy tried to make us leave by clean everything on the table ( especially the water that I still drinking). The new waiter told me:&#34; just tell me what you want to pay!&#34; After I mentioned that today is my birthday. Do I get a cheese cake for free? I usually a easy personal and not complain. Because I have 2 friends work at cheese factory that they told me the host suppose ask if we have any special events going before they sit us; but the host didn&#39;t ask me anything. Bad service, nobody sing and no cake ( even I mentioned it) Well, overall, it was the worst birthday dinner I ever had.

Clearly everyone that works here Hates their life! This location is horrible. Waited for over an hour for a table and finally just sat at the bar. Everyone from the hostess to the bartender were just straight up rude! Don&#39;t waste your time going here

The Cheesecake premium reserve was fantastic wine.  My partner ordered the Shepard&#39;s Pie which he said was delicious.  I ordered the vegetable salad with chicken.  The asparagus was chopped so small, that it was hard to tell what it was.  The other vegetables were so small that they all fell to the bottom of the bowl.  The chicken was cold.  Overall, a tasteless and bland salad.  We ordered the Kahlua cheesecake for dessert and it was okay, although it didn&#39;t really taste like cheesecake.  The service was good, I would go back, but choose a different entree.
